description: The year when the data was recorded or projected.
The U.S. state where the data is collected or projected.
The age group, particularly individuals aged 65 and over, analyzed for Alzheimer's prevalence.
Gender of the individuals, used to analyze differences in Alzheimer's disease prevalence.
Ethnicity of individuals, including non-Hispanic Black, Hispanic, and White categories, to compare Alzheimer's disease prevalence.
The percentage of individuals within each demographic group diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease.
The number of Alzheimer’s disease cases recorded or projected among specific demographic groups.
The rate at which new instances of Alzheimer's disease occur, particularly differentiated by sex.
Factors affecting the risk of developing Alzheimer's disease, including age, gender, and ethnicity.
The impact of Alzheimer’s disease prevalence on the healthcare systems, including costs related to long-term care and Medicaid programs.
